item.title: Part 7: The End Arrives
item.dc:creator: Vatsalya Chaubey
item.description: It has now been twelve weeks since I began this journey and finally, the curtains on this arduous and breathtaking adventure have been begun to fall. This week it will be last week as an official Google Summer of Code and this will be my final post as a student. I can feel the nostalgia gripping me. ...READ MORE...

item.dc:creator: Kris Stern
item.description: GSoC 2019: Project IRISpy 3.2 — Reaching the GoalsIt is my pleasure to report that with my mentors’ assistance as well as my many hours of contributing to the sunpy/irispy GitHub repo, I have been able to reach all four goals original set out by the primary mentor Danny Ryan, which are as follows:Th ...READ MORE...

item.title: Start to work on PFSS
item.dc:creator: Tianxiao MA
item.description: In this week, I started to move to Potential Field Source Surface (PFSS) models. I am going to make an introduction to these models in this post.PFSS models are aiming to solve the magnetic field satisfying∇ × B = 0, ∇ · B = 0in a spherical region with appropriate boundary conditions. Therefore, thi ...READ MORE...

item.title: Visualization of 3D vector fields
item.dc:creator: Tianxiao MA
item.description: In the past few weeks, I spent a lot of time learning how to visualize a 3D vector field interactively. As mentioned in previous posts, my project is aiming to reconstruct the solar magnetic field according to boundary conditions, which are usually the observed image from satellites.Therefore, how t ...READ MORE...

item.title: Part 6: Reaching the Summit
